thread.title: NAM Expands Its Executive Team and Adds Senior Leadership to Its Marketing Ranks

author: cnbc.com
title: NAM Expands Its Executive Team and Adds Senior Leadership to Its Marketing Ranks
text:
NEW YORK--(BUSINESS WIRE)-- NAM (National Arbitration and Mediation) is pleased to announce the addition of Joe Borstein, Esq. and Anna Diolosa to the firm’s executive and marketing leadership teams, respectively.
This press release features multimedia. View the full release here: http://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20180213005364/en/
Joe Borstein, Esq., Chief Revenue Officer (Photo: Business Wire)
Both join the company as NAM is experiencing record pace growth for its Alternative Dispute Resolution (ADR) services nationwide. Mr. Borstein is the new Chief Revenue Officer and is charged with developing, implementing and overseeing the strategic revenue goals for the company. Ms. Diolosa has been hired as the new Vice President of Marketing and will be responsible for leading the development and implementation of communications, marketing and business development strategies designed to reinforce the value of the company’s dispute resolution services. Together, Mr. Borstein and Ms. Diolosa will coordinate NAM’s sales and marketing efforts to elevate the firm’s footprint in the ADR market as well as accelerate growth and drive brand awareness.
Roy Israel, President and CEO of NAM stated, “With the increasing demand for NAM’s dispute resolution services, Joe and Anna are a welcomed addition to NAM’s executive ranks. Both have a track record of successfully building out broad sales and marketing platforms and identifying compelling marketing opportunities which will help to accelerate NAM’s growth and extend our market leadership position within the business and legal communities nationwide.”
Prior to joining NAM, Mr. Borstein served as Global Director at Pangea3, where he managed a global team dedicated to counseling law firms and corporate clients on integrating and leveraging Pangea3’s legal outsourcing solutions. Joe worked with AM Law 200 law firms and Fortune 1000 companies to effectively and efficiently manage the high-volume, repeatable legal tasks associated with complex litigation, M&A, contract management and global risk management/compliance. Before his tenure at Pangea3, Mr. Borstein practiced for six years as a litigation associate at Kasowitz, Benson & Torres LLP and received his Juris Doctor from Penn Law at the University of Pennsylvania.
With more than 15 years of B2B marketing experience, Ms. Diolosa recently served as the Senior Manager of Marketing & Business Development at BDO USA, LLP where she worked with the firm’s Advisory Group and its leadership to develop and implement transformational marketing strategies, processes and best practices to accelerate market awareness and client engagement. Her expertise also includes managing integrated marketing programs, go-to-market strategies, digital and print communications, content development and cohesive and effective event strategies.
ABOUT NAM
Founded in 1992, NAM (National Arbitration and Mediation) is recognized for its superb customer service and exceptional panel of arbitrators and mediators. For the third year in a row, NAM was named Best ADR Firm in the United States by the 2018 National Law Journal Annual Reader Rankings Survey. Also, six of NAM’s neutrals were named National Law Journal 2017 Alternative Dispute Resolution Champions as part of a select group of only 37 nationwide. NAM also ranked as a Best National ADR Provider by the 2017 Corporate Counsel Best of Survey. The New York Law Journal Annual Reader Rankings Survey selected NAM as the No. 1 ADR firm for the past seven years. NAM was also voted a “Best Overall ADR Provider” in the 2017 Best of The New Jersey Law Journal and Best of the Midwest annual surveys.
NAM works with more than 10,000 commercial entities, including more than 50 percent of the Fortune 100 companies. NAM offers litigants a nationwide panel of more than 2,500 top-tier former judges and practicing specialists uniquely qualified to facilitate the resolution of disputes in a private forum. NAM maintains rosters in all 50 states, Puerto Rico and in major cities around the world, with specific expertise in the areas of complex commercial, construction, employment, entertainment, financial services, international, insurance, medical malpractice, personal injury (including third-party and first-party actions), professional liability and real estate dispute resolution. NAM is an indispensable resource for parties seeking cost-effective alternatives to expensive and time-consuming litigation.
NAM provides complimentary continuing legal education programs for attorneys, bar associations, corporate and government legal departments, and other legal and business organizations.
